availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Casey County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Bowman. Father of James M. Bowman, Hisletta Bowman, Susan E. Bowman, John Bowman, George Bowman, Theodore Bowman, Florida A. Bowman, Augusta Bowman, Josephine Bowman, Alexander Bowman. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant from December 23, 1863, to January 10, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 355.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 911.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 770.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Casey County, Rolling Fork, p. 250A.
